Prologue

ALY

[I]0-i tried to see what [others]181-others saw in [him]182-he . [I]0-i ’m sure the height hit [them]181-others first . Six feet and [two inches of pure athletic muscle]183-two inches of pure athletic muscle was bound to grab attention . [I]0-i got that . [I]0-i got that the stupid thing [he]182-he did with [his]182-he hair made [all the girls]184-all the girls and even [teachers]185-teachers swoon . Of course , [I]0-i was n’t convinced [he]182-he did n’t know exactly what [he]182-he was doing [there]186-there . [I]0-i mean who honestly ran both hands slooowly through [their]187-their hair in the middle of talking to [someone]188-someone ? It was ridiculously sensual – especially when it always left [his]182-he hair so perfectly tousled , like [he]182-he ’d just rolled out of bed . Then there was [his]182-he voice . Low and kind of gravelly . The dark hair , light eyes combo – that was a thing too . [I]0-i got that . But [I]0-i just could n’t get past what [a prick]189-a prick [the kid]190-the kid was . [[Our]191-our dads]192-our dads were [best friends]193-best friends , and having grown up with [Emmett Hoult]56-emmett , [I]0-i could n’t see the appeal that [everyone]194-everyone saw . All [I]0-i could see was what [they]194-everyone could n’t . When [the world]195-the world looked at [Emmett]56-emmett , [they]195-the world saw confident , devilish , sexy . [I]0-i saw cocky , spoiled , arrogant . [[Your]196-your typical all - American jock]197-your typical all - american jock . [I]0-i saw [the kid [I]0-i was forced to spend every weekend and vacation of [my]0-i childhood]198-the kid i was forced to spend every weekend and vacation of my childhood with – the one that Xeroxed the worst photos [he]56-emmett could find in [my]0-i family albums , just so [he]56-emmett could tack them all over [[[my]0-i crush]199-my crush ’s locker]200-my crush ’s locker . [I]0-i saw [the kid who got away with literally everything , no matter who [I]0-i complained to]201-the kid who got away with literally everything , no matter who i complained to . [Teachers]185-teachers , [coaches]203-coaches , even [the school principal]204-the school principal looked at [me]0-i as a nuisance . A thorn in [their]205-they side . All [they]205-they wanted was to adore [Emmett Hoult]56-emmett in peace – to be completely charmed by [his]56-emmett playful , laid back nature . The last thing [they]205-they wanted was to have to acknowledge [me]0-i , the surly buzzkill whose griping would get [him]56-emmett undoubtedly pulled from practice , something [the football team]206-the football team “ just could n’t afford . ”[206-the football team] Even [[my]0-i parents]207-my parents defended [his]56-emmett every move . “ It ’s just a sibling rivalry , ”[57-mom] [Mom]57-mom would brush it off . “ [You]0-i grew up together . [You]0-i ’re practically [family]1566-family . But give [it]1567-it a few years , [Aly]58-aly , and [I]57-mom ’m sure [you]0-i ’ll get on great . ”[57-mom] Right . [I]0-i gave it a few years , and all [Emmett]56-emmett did was get worse . In high school , all it took was one evening of [[his]56-emmett mom]208-his mom comparing [[his]56-emmett bad friends]209-his bad friends , bad grades or bad behavior to [mine]0-i , and [I]0-i ’d wind up paying for it with a week of torture at [school]210-school . [[His]56-emmett teammates]211-his teammates snickered at [me]0-i in [the halls]212-the halls . [He]56-emmett spread the nickname “ [Baldy]59-baldy ”[56-emmett] when [I]0-i botched [my]0-i haircut sophomore year . By the time [I]0-i was [a junior]213-a junior , [I]0-i was down to [just three friends who did n’t worship [him]56-emmett or use [me]0-i to get close to [him]56-emmett]214-just three friends who did n’t worship him or use me to get close to him , and [he]56-emmett told [me]0-i – “ just for shits and giggles ”[56-emmett] – that [he]56-emmett ’d hook up with every one of [them]214-just three friends who did n’t worship him or use me to get close to him so [I]0-i ’d have [no allies left to gripe to]215-no allies left to gripe to . And [he]56-emmett did precisely that . In short , with very little effort involved , [Emmett Hoult]56-emmett took over [my]0-i entire life . At [home]216-home , [Dad]60-dad raved nonstop about [his]60-dad athletic achievements . At [school]210-school , [he]56-emmett ruled [every last hallway]218-every last hallway and [classroom]219-classroom . Even at night , in the privacy of [[my]0-i bedroom]220-my bedroom , [I]0-i could n’t escape the constant texts from [friends]221-friends [he]56-emmett ’d “ mysteriously ”[221-friends] ghosted . [They]221-friends sobbed for [me]0-i to help figure out what went wrong , or begged [me]0-i to subtly bring [them]221-friends up to [Emmett]56-emmett when [we]222-we saw [each other]223-each other that weekend . [They]221-friends did n’t seem to realize [he]56-emmett ’d never hang out with [them]221-friends again – that [he]56-emmett only hooked up with [them]221-friends to get under [my]0-i skin . [He]56-emmett did n’t even remember most of [their]221-friends names . Simply put , [the kid]190-the kid was [an asshole]225-an asshole . [He]56-emmett always got what [he]56-emmett wanted , [he]56-emmett did n’t have to try , and [he]56-emmett never even knew how much [his]56-emmett antics made [me]0-i cry every night . While [I]0-i was completely miserable , [he]56-emmett just carried on with [his]56-emmett perfectly charmed life . And so [I]0-i hated [him]56-emmett . For all the many stunts [he]56-emmett pulled on [me]0-i , [I]0-i despised [Emmett Hoult]56-emmett . But amazingly , all that crap happened before the last week of junior year . That was the week [he]56-emmett truly ruined [my]0-i life .

1

ALY

Unbelievable . [AUNT AUDREY]63-aunt audrey : Yes [he]56-emmett will be in [the Maldives]259-the maldives for the next three weeks ! [She]63-aunt audrey was n’t kidding . [I]0-i was n’t big on pitying [myself]0-i , but this last week had seriously put [me]0-i through the wringer , starting with the electrical fire that tore through [[my]0-i Sag Harbor apartment]263-my sag harbor apartment in under thirty minutes . Thankfully , [I]0-i was at the café when it happened . [Evie]61-evie and [I]0-i had poured every last penny of [our]264-our savings into buying the dead company from [Dad]60-dad , and as a seasonal business in its very first year , [I]0-i had a lot to prove in just a few months ’ time . That [we]264-our did , because on top of a surprise fire this week , [I]0-i also had nearly a lifetime of insomnia working against [me]0-i . [I]0-i had n’t slept more than three hours a night for two months now , and while [I]0-i was generally happy to run on fumes , tomorrow was a different story . [ALY]66-aly

31

34

36

ALY

EMMETT]1395-emmett 37 emmett

[EMMETT]122-emmett
